meanings.definition: To protrude through an abnormal opening
meanings.sent1: The disk in his back was herniating, causing him pain.
meanings.sent2: The balloon started herniating out of the small hole.
meanings.sent3: The overstuffed suitcase looked like it was herniating at the seams.
meanings.sent4: The truth began herniating through his carefully constructed lies.
meanings.sent5: The popcorn bag was herniating with the delicious smell of butter.

meanings.definition: To cause to protrude through an abnormal opening
meanings.sent1: She tried to lift the heavy box, herniating her back in the process.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind herniated the umbrella inside out.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel herniated the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: His loud laughter herniated the silence of the library.
meanings.sent5: The chef's flavorful dish herniated the aroma throughout the kitchen.
